page.title: 10Horses and Riding 2
page.content: With all the interest in horses, {riding centres}are a popular feature. {The Shirley Holms Activity Centre} which comprises of a country house with{150 acres}of land has direct access on to the New Forest. It caters for all kinds of riding, jumping and cross country, carriage drives, swimming and educational farm visits. However, at the time of our survey (June 1985),it was in the process of being sold. We were told it would be re-opening under new management. { East Street Riding Stables}in Pitmore Lane opened in 1983. They have 12 stables and 30 horses and 1 stable in which to keep grain. They keep 2 cats to protect the feed from rats & mice. They own{1\ acres}of land but are able to use other fields for grazing. Only a few horses are kept in the stable as most are hardy enough to stay outside.
